Problem:

The effect of a transformation defined by \\( f(z) = e^{Nt}z \\) is studied, where N is also a constant complex matrix.

If at a certain time \\( t_1 \\), a new function \\( g(z) = e^{Pt}z \\) (where P is another constant complex matrix) is applied as an intervention, will the endpoint \\( z(T) \\) for T > t_1 depend only on M and not on N or P?
Explanation: The addition of the intervention \\( g(z) \\) introduces another transformation component in the form of \\( e^{Pt} \\). The outcome at time T will then depend on the interactions among M, N, and P. These matrix effects could differentially modify the trajectory, making the final state a function of all matrices involved.
